paint.shared.io

Class BaseTableIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • paint.shared.io.BaseTableIO
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExperimentInfoTableIO, RecordingTableIO, SquareTableIO, TrackTableIO

    public abstract class BaseTableIO
extends Object
    Abstract base class for consistent CSV and Table I/O across the PAINT modules. Provides shared implementations for reading, validating, appending, and writing tabular data using Tablesaw.

      Validates that the column types in the table match the expected schema.
      void writeCsv(tech.tablesaw.api.Table table, Path target)
      Writes a Table to a CSV file using a stable US locale with fixed three-decimal formatting for floating-point values.

    • Method Detail

      • newEmptyTable

        protected tech.tablesaw.api.Table newEmptyTable(String tableName,
                                                String[] colNames,
                                                tech.tablesaw.api.ColumnType[] colTypes)
        Creates a new empty Table with the given schema.
        Parameters:
        tableName - name of the table to create
        colNames - array of column names
        colTypes - array of corresponding ColumnTypes
        Returns:
        a new empty Table with the specified schema
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the lengths of colNames and colTypes differ

      • appendInPlace

        public void appendInPlace(tech.tablesaw.api.Table target,
                          tech.tablesaw.api.Table source)
        Appends all rows from source into target in place. Both tables must have identical schemas.
        Parameters:
        target - the Table to append rows into
        source - the Table providing rows to append
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the tables have different schemas

      • buildCsvReadOptions

        protected tech.tablesaw.io.csv.CsvReadOptions buildCsvReadOptions(Path csvPath,
                                                                  tech.tablesaw.api.ColumnType[] colTypes)
        Builds a CsvReadOptions instance enforcing the provided column types.
        Parameters:
        csvPath - path to the CSV file
        colTypes - expected ColumnTypes for the file
        Returns:
        configured CsvReadOptions

      • readCsvWithSchema

        public tech.tablesaw.api.Table readCsvWithSchema(Path csvPath,
                                                 String logicalName,
                                                 String[] expectedCols,
                                                 tech.tablesaw.api.ColumnType[] expectedTypes,
                                                 boolean allowSuperset)
                                          throws IOException
        Reads a CSV file into a Table with a known schema and validates its header and types.
        Parameters:
        csvPath - path to the CSV file
        logicalName - logical name used for error reporting
        expectedCols - expected column names in order
        expectedTypes - expected ColumnTypes in order
        allowSuperset - whether extra columns are allowed
        Returns:
        a validated Table
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file cannot be read or validation fails

      • validateHeader

        protected List<String> validateHeader(tech.tablesaw.api.Table t,
                                      String[] expectedCols,
                                      boolean allowSuperset)
        Validates that the table header matches the expected columns.
        Parameters:
        t - the Table to validate
        expectedCols - expected column names
        allowSuperset - whether extra columns are allowed
        Returns:
        a list of validation error messages (empty if valid)

      • validateTypes

        protected List<String> validateTypes(tech.tablesaw.api.Table t,
                                     String[] names,
                                     tech.tablesaw.api.ColumnType[] types)
        Validates that the column types in the table match the expected schema.
        Parameters:
        t - the Table to validate
        names - expected column names
        types - expected ColumnTypes
        Returns:
        a list of validation error messages (empty if valid)

      • writeCsv

        public void writeCsv(tech.tablesaw.api.Table table,
                     Path target)
              throws IOException
        Writes a Table to a CSV file using a stable US locale with fixed three-decimal formatting for floating-point values.
        Parameters:
        table - the Table to write
        target - target file path
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing fails
